replies.bodyText: just turned this into a slimefun item, no need for an item use handler now right?  Unless it needs to be blocked in crafting recipes? (is that even a thing) ?
replies.author: dniym

timeline.bodyText: Why is this even marked as NotPlaceable here? Brown dye cannot be placed anyway.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
Why not do (entity instance of Villager) instead of this weird double-check.
Should Mojang decide to add more types of Merchants, it would break too. So a Villager instanceof check is most appropriate here.
Especially if you are casting this to Villager anyway, since that would otherwise result in unexpected class casting exceptions.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Hmmm I was pretty sure I did this for a reason since the merchant/villager api is so flaky.  Maybe it was that I checked to merchant because a regular villager will pass the villager instanceof check but not have any trades or a job.    A merchant object however will have a job but wandering traders can’t change profession because they’re not villagers.  Anyways I suppose I could just check to make sure they have a job before resetting.     I’ll do some testing to make sure it won’t cause issues!
replies.author: dniym

replies.bodyText: upon further testing it appears to be fine with wandering traders.
replies.author: dniym

timeline.bodyText:
You can also just specify a count when spawning particles, I see no reason for this loop here.
Also the formatting is completely off.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
Two brackets with the same level of indentation :NotLikeThis:
This is how you make code confusing.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Why have all these empty lines here...?
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.message: added a check for jobless villagers

timeline.bodyText: This empty line can be removed.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Should probably also add a "validateInput" method to make sure it's between 1-99.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
There is a line that checks this in the piglin listener.. do you think it should be done on a per item basis? Or on maybe the barter drop interface instead?
https://github.com/TheBusyBiscuit/Slimefun4/pull/2220/files/b27059240b6305e89bb058fdce15b62ba4d08019#diff-030aa5ca3b19598a3acad3d2ccc70609
replies.author: dniym

replies.bodyText:
know that it is checked there.
But you should validate inputs like that on the ItemSetting level too, so that server owners will be notified that their settings are misconfigured.
In general, illegal values should be checked on all levels of implementation.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: I don't really see why we would need a new research for this.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:

replies.author: dniym

Not sure if we really need any see tag here though in the first place.
